noun.description: An edible kidney-shaped nut, rich in oil and protein, which is roasted and shelled before it can be eaten. Oil is extracted from the shells and used as a lubricant and insecticide and in the production of plastics.
A bushy tropical American tree related to the mango, bearing cashew nuts singly at the tip of each swollen fruit.

origin: Late 16th century: from Portuguese, from Tupi acajú, cajú.
